articles.headline: Reform Bill Adds Layers of Oversight
articles.snippet: Senate Democrats put forward a plan, with the backing of the Obama administration, that calls for Washington to play a more active role in policing Wall Street.
articles.abstract: Senate Democrats put forward a plan, with the backing of the Obama administration, that calls for Washington to play a more active role in policing Wall Street.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The 1,336-page bill to overhaul financial regulation that Senate Democrats put forward on Monday with the backing of the Obama administration calls for Washington to play a more active role in policing Wall Street.

articles.headline: German Priest in Church Abuse Case Is Suspended
articles.snippet: The priest at the center of a sex-abuse scandal that has embroiled the pope worked with children for decades after he was convicted of molestation.
articles.abstract: The priest at the center of a sex-abuse scandal that has embroiled the pope worked with children for decades after he was convicted of molestation.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUNICH — The priest at the center of a German sexual-abuse scandal that has embroiled Pope Benedict XVI continued working with children for more than 30 years, even though a German court convicted him of molesting boys.

articles.headline: Corporate Debt Coming Due May Squeeze Credit
articles.snippet: More than $700 billion of high-yield debt will mature over a three-year period beginning in 2012, raising worries about new loans, defaults and bankruptcies.
articles.abstract: More than $700 billion of high-yield debt will mature over a three-year period beginning in 2012, raising worries about new loans, defaults and bankruptcies.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the Mayans envisioned the world coming to an end in 2012 — at least in the Hollywood telling — they didn’t count junk bonds among the perils that would lead to worldwide disaster.

articles.headline: Moody’s Says U.S. Debt Could Test Triple-A Rating
articles.snippet: The ratings of the United States, Britain, Germany and France are stable, but “their ‘distance-to-downgrade’ has in all cases substantially diminished,” Moody’s Investors Service said.
articles.abstract: The ratings of the United States, Britain, Germany and France are stable, but “their ‘distance-to-downgrade’ has in all cases substantially diminished,” Moody’s Investors Service said.
articles.lead_paragraph: The gold-plated credit rating of the United States — an article of faith across America and, indeed, around the world — may be at risk in coming years as the nation copes with its growing debts.
articles.byline: By David Jolly and Catherine Rampell

articles.headline: U.S. Is Reining In Special Operations Forces in Afghanistan
articles.snippet: Action by the top American commander in Afghanistan, Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal, was taken in part because of concern over civilian casualties.
articles.abstract: Action by the top American commander in Afghanistan, Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal, was taken in part because of concern over civilian casualties.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal, the top American commander in Afghanistan, has brought most American Special Operations forces under his direct control for the first time, out of concern over continued civilian casualties and disorganization among units in the field.
articles.byline: By Richard A. Oppel Jr. and Rod Nordland

articles.headline: Triumph for Drug to Straighten Clenched Fingers
articles.snippet: After 50 years, a tiny drug maker on Long Island has found a potentially lucrative use for its only medicine.
articles.abstract: After 50 years, a tiny drug maker on Long Island has found a potentially lucrative use for its only medicine.
articles.lead_paragraph: It took half a century. But a tiny drug maker on Long Island has finally found a potentially lucrative use for its only medicine: straightening clenched fingers. And, if research proves successful, treating a condition that causes bent penises.

articles.headline: At Lehman, Watchdogs Saw It All
articles.snippet: It appears that the federal government didn’t appreciate the significance of what it saw as it monitored the books and records of Lehman Brothers, or that officials blessed the company’s now-suspect accounting.
articles.abstract: It appears that the federal government didn’t appreciate the significance of what it saw as it monitored the books and records of Lehman Brothers, or that officials blessed the company’s now-suspect accounting.
articles.lead_paragraph: Almost two years ago to the day, a team of officials from the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Federal Reserve Bank of New York quietly moved into the headquarters of Lehman Brothers. They were provided desks, phones, computers — and access to all of Lehman’s books and records. At any given moment, there were as many as a dozen government officials buzzing around Lehman’s offices.

articles.headline: Drug Giants Lag Where Sales Boom, Study Says
articles.snippet: As pharmaceutical sales in countries like China and India overtake established markets, leading drug companies risk losing market share to local players, a study said.
articles.abstract: As pharmaceutical sales in countries like China and India overtake established markets, leading drug companies risk losing market share to local players, a study said.
articles.lead_paragraph: The leading drug makers need to move quickly to adapt to a new world order in which some emerging markets are set to overtake some established national markets in pharmaceutical sales, according to a report issued Tuesday.
